intro: Draba lasiopoda, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–20 cm, with basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, yellowish-white, and arranged in a raceme, blooming in early spring. Draba lasiopoda is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often adapted to harsh, rocky environments.
